entry.title: Combined summary - Why are my posts being put in new threads?
entry.summary: To address the author's inquiry, a link to a webpage explaining how email threading works was provided. This webpage explains that email threading is the process of grouping emails with the same topic together. It further elaborates that different email clients utilize different methods to determine which messages belong to a particular thread. While some email clients rely on the subject line for identification purposes, others make use of the In-Reply-To or References header fields.This exchange between Eric Lombrozo and the individual providing the link highlights the complexities involved in email threading. It underscores the significance of understanding how various email clients handle this process to ensure effective communication. By gaining insight into the mechanisms behind email threading, individuals can avoid confusion and facilitate more streamlined conversations within threads.
